summary:
Dr. Logan Stuck is an epidemiologist, statistician, and data scientist with over seven years of experience using these skills for innovation in the research, control, and prevention of infectious diseases and other causes of morbidity and mortality in vulnerable populations. He has conducted field work in Ethiopia, mainland Tanzania, Zanzibar, Zambia, and Zimbabwe and supported research remotely for many other countries. These projects included intervention program evaluation projects, cost evaluations, as well as leading workshops to build quantitative research capacity.

Following his bachelor’s degree at St. Olaf College in Northfield, Minnesota, USA, Logan worked as a grant writer at Monument Health in Rapid City, South Dakota, USA, then pursued a master’s degree in biostatistics at the University of Minnesota in Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA. After receiving his MS in Biostatistics, Logan worked as a statistician for the Health Partners Institute in Minnesota until enrolling as a doctoral student at the Tulane School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine in New Orleans, Louisiana, USA, where his dissertation research focused on the evaluation of systems effectiveness and cost of reactive case detection for malaria in Zanzibar. After receiving his PhD, he acquired a position as an epidemiologist and postdoctoral fellow at the Amsterdam Institute for Global Health and Development in Amsterdam, Netherlands where he currently works today.

projects:
[{'title': 'Assessment of the Zimbabwe Assistance Program in Malaria', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': '"Data for Impact (D4I) is conducting an assessment of the Zimbabwe Assistance Program in Malaria (ZAPIM)—an implementing partner of the United States President’s Malaria Initiative (PMI)/Zimbabwe. ZAPIM supports the capacity of the National Malaria Control Programme (NMCP) to prevent and treat malaria and work toward the NMCP’s 2016–2020 Strategic Plan goals, which includes both malaria control and elimination.

D4I’s assessment uses quantitative methods to analyze existing routine and other secondary data sources, and uses qualitative methods to identify strengths and areas to improve in NMCP’s current capacity to manage and implement malaria interventions. Results will guide PMI/Zimbabwe and the USAID mission to make decisions on appropriate strategies to strengthen NMCP capacity and to choose interventions best suited for PMI support as the country moves toward malaria elimination."', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Logan', 'last_name': 'Stuck', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Statistician. Epidemiologist. Data scientist. Lecturer.'}]}, {'title': 'Capacity building workshops for data analytics and GIS in R', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'Developed material and conducted data analytics and GIS workshops for monitoring and evaluation professionals in health ministries of Tanzania and Zanzibar. Taught in R, RStudio, and qGIS.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Logan', 'last_name': 'Stuck', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Statistician. Epidemiologist. Data scientist. Lecturer.'}]}, {'title': 'Reactive Case Detection in Zanzibar: System-Effectiveness and Cost', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'The overall aim of the project was to evaluate the use of RCD as a tool for the identification and treatment of malaria infections in Zanzibar. More specifically it aimed, first, to evaluate the most basic assumption that the prevalence of malaria is higher within the index household and possibly amongst neighbors of the index household than the background prevalence in Zanzibar. Secondly, it aimed to evaluate RCD as a tool to target and treat these infections, should they exist. Finally, it aimed to assess the effectiveness and economic cost of RCD and whether a number of alternative strategies might be more effective at a similar or lower cost.

This project provided the data for my doctoral dissertation. I was involved in all aspects of the research from concept note, on-the-ground implementation, to statistical analysis and dissemination.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Logan', 'last_name': 'Stuck', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Statistician. The study design was a household survey conducted both in control and intervention districts. 'description': 'Primary duties include statistical and methodological support and data management for ongoing research. Study designs vary greatly, including clinical trials, prospective observational studies, retrospective studies, and even agent-based probabilistic modeling.

Specific Duties:
¥	Conduct power analyses including simulations for complex, multicenter trials
¥	Construct randomization schedules for clinical trials
¥	Determine appropriate study design and analytical methods for studies in development
¥	Data management
¥	Conduct final analyses of trial data, as well as working closely with PIs to appropriately interpret findings
¥	In charge of methodological and analytical portions of study protocols, grant applications, and manuscripts
¥	Serve on the Institute IRB panel

Selected Current Research
¥	Clinical trial exploring the effect of intranasal insulin on cognition in adults with mild to moderate cognitive impairment
¥	Clinical trial exploring the effect of intranasal insulin on cognition in adults with Downs Syndrome
¥	Prospective study exploring the effect of exercise on cognition in Parkinson’s patients
¥	Long term observational study of patients with mild to moderate cognitive impairment
¥	Multi-center trial exploring the effect of a clinical decision support tool on physician prescribing behavior in children and adolescents presenting with abdominal pain
¥	Agent-based intervention population modeling with Robert Woods Johnson Foundation (www.communityhealthadvisor.org)
¥	US Preventative Services Task Force Collaboration on updating recommendations on low-dose Aspirin use for CVD and cancer prevention', 'title': 'Biostatistician Consultant', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 65443, 'name': 'Monument Health', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHGMDodnIxRpw/company-logo_400_400/0/1579282583000?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=lWqvzm4h8Z-fDXapK2SfeWktaJHauxU9S9T7vj58lgI', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/monument-health-system/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Rapid City, South Dakota, United States', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'company': 'Monument Health', 'description': None, 'title': 'Grant Writer', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 5350, 'name': 'World Health Organization', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQEhC1u0R5DRQQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1663777944960?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=j5hFxDNxJXWTH17YwPs98UUMHEDU2aNYw37szFDW218', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/world-health-organization/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Geneva Area, Switzerland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'company': 'World Health Organization', 'description': None, 'title': 'Foodborne Epidemiological Reference Group Intern', 'employment_type': 'Internship'}]}]
